Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Insect defensin (AcDEF?; natural AMPs; UCSS1a; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bridges: 4,26; 11,34; 15, 36.Activity: Diffusion diameter 10 pmol peptide: Active against Gram+ M. luteus, A. viridans, P. acidiluctici, B. megaterium, and S. pyogenes, not S.aureus, and Gram- A. faecalis, not L.monocytogenes, S.typhimurium, P.aeruginosa, P.cepacia, and E.coli D22. Primarily active against Gram+ bacteria.Updated 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Bulet P, Cociancich S, Reuland M, Sauber F, Bischoff R, Hegy G, van Dorsselaer A, Hetru C, Hoffmann JA.1992
Literature Information.Title: A novel insect defensin mediates the inducible antibacterial activity in larvae of the dragonfly Aeschna cyanea (Paleoptera, Odonata).
